TopicTitle: Platform Enigma- an off topic chat thread.

Articles.Content:
The Chobit is a chobit. There. Debate ended.

Don't the chobits come in different genders? If you look at enough comments you should be able to work out chobits gender.
Check the 2nd insane thread. I have determined that she is female.
Do Chobits have hair on their feet like Hobbits?
she? seems to refer to her? self as female alot.

she? seems to refer to her? self as female alot.

Trekkette also refers to her as a she.
I go play Minecraft, miss the Star Trek discussion and return to the "Chobit's Gender" discussion. Always a classic, that one...
So it's settled; Chobit is female. at least until she comes and screws with our minds again.
this seems appropriate

I would pay 10 U.S dollars for something like a mini-Chobit figurine.

I would like to had my kerbal too... but it will need Big glasses, dirty hairs and coffee stains on lab-coat .

EDIT_1:

Is that mode by any chance a result of KSP?

Noo... this is an reason why I like KSP ;P.

Edited May 27, 2013 by karolus10

I go play Minecraft, miss the Star Trek discussion and return to the "Chobit's Gender" discussion. Always a classic, that one...

Do you want Star trek discussions? Ok then, what did you think of Into Darkness?

Do you want Star trek discussions? Ok then, what did you think of Into Darkness?
I hate the new Star Trek stuff. It lost everything Star Trek stood for: Exploration and Discovery. Its just action and explosions like most modern movies:(

I liked Into Darkness. I made a point of avoiding all the spoilers I could, and disbelieving the ones I did find. Of course, after reading the TvTropes page on it, I like it a little less. I was fine with not noticing those plot holes, tyvm!

It was really funny. When the true identity of the villian was revealed, Chobit and I very audibly went *GASP*. Only people in the theatre to react. We got weird looks. I also got weird looks for wearing my tShirt with TREKKIE across the front.

You could totally tell who was there for STAR TREK and who was there for, hey new movie, though. Made me kinda sad.

Check the 2nd insane thread. I have determined that she is female.

I wantz a link.

Personally I like new star-trek, it's different but Kirk/Spock combo is good combination for action movies as well .

I would like to see at least miniseries of star-trek with new movie crew, but it can't happen I guess .

EDIT_1:

Also Star-Trek the video-game, wasn't impress me... I must try bridge commander again, some day (game is quite old ,but still had some appeal left).

Edited May 27, 2013 by karolus10

I liked Into Darkness. I made a point of avoiding all the spoilers I could, and disbelieving the ones I did find. Of course, after reading the TvTropes page on it, I like it a little less. I was fine with not noticing those plot holes, tyvm!

It was really funny. When the true identity of the villian was revealed, Chobit and I very audibly went *GASP*. Only people in the theatre to react. We got weird looks. I also got weird looks for wearing my tShirt with TREKKIE across the front.

You could totally tell who was there for STAR TREK and who was there for, hey new movie, though. Made me kinda sad.

There's a TvTropes page on it?

I know what you meant, it was clear in my cinema who was there for star trek and the rest. It all depended on their reactions to previous star trek references, there were none from the rest of the audience

People probably gave you those weird looks as they would of subscribed to the stereotypical version of a star trek fan and you broke them all.

I dislike Zoe Saldana as Uhura. I have no idea why, though. Karl Urban makes a great McCoy, Zachary Quinto does Spock really well, John Cho is great as Sulu (HOLY FLIYING PIGS, Sulu in Into Darkness was PERFECT), Simon Pegg as Scotty is a little sillier than I might like and the guy playing Chekov (whose name I can't remember and refuse to look up...) plays the naive ensign really well.

I like Chris Pine as Kirk, too. At least this new universe rebel!Kirk. Granted Prime!Kirk was never less than a cowboy anyway. He at least pretended to deliberate. Nu!Kirk... doesn't.

There's a TvTropes page on it?

You're Welcome
